children.subject:
yes we'll post about academic intern opportunities closer to the start of the course :) 

EDIT: we are revising the course to fit in the online format, and this may not be true anymore :/
Will there be Academic Intern positions available for the summer for 61A? I will be interested in applying for the same.
Bumping this, when can we expect to hear back?
I can’t speak to the timeline, but everyone should get a response if it’s anything like previous years

Should we only expect a response if we're selected? Additionally, is there a timeline for when notifications would be released?

Thanks.
Hi! Are you planning on carrying over these same roles remotely if summer classes are done online? (I can't be in Berkeley but would love to apply)
Update: I see Derek's response to the followup above, but I wasn't sure if this applied to post-interview, which is why I asked.

Yes you will get a final decision email at some point. We also just sent out initial TA decisions. There will likely be a few more TAs to hire when the course reaches full capacity and we still haven't sent out tutors decisions. It is also possible that the class will expand in size, in which case we would hire a handful more of TAs and tutors. So we haven't definitively finished hiring yet, but when we do there will be a mass email.
Sounds great, thank you so much for the update!

Quick question (not about timeline!): can we expect a post-interview response regardless of whether we are selected or not, or will only the selected candidates receive an email? Apologies if this has been answered before!

history.content:
Hi! Ryan Moughan, Chae Park, and I (Kavi Gupta) will all be teaching CS61A this summer. We are looking for dedicated and passionate TAs and tutors to teach with us! TAing or tutoring over the summer is extremely rewarding, much more fun than during regular semesters, and a great way to get started if you're interested in teaching :)
$$\dfrac{}{}$$
Here's a brief description of the TA role (20 hours / week):
+ teach 2 labs and 2 discussions each week
+ proctor and grade exams
+ hold office hours
+ attend weekly staff meetings
+ be involved in other logistical responsibilities, such as: curriculum development, contests, cheating detection, project support, responding to Piazza, web development, improving OK, etc.
$$\dfrac{}{}$$
And here's a brief description of the tutor role (12 hours / week):
+ teach small group tutoring sections
+ hold office hours
+ attend weekly staff meetings
+ grade specific assignments
$$\dfrac{}{}$$
To apply, you'll need to complete BOTH the CS61A staff application (links.cs61a.org/su20-application) and the department's official application (https://links.cs61a.org/ase-application). The priority deadline is March 1st. We'll be sorting through these responses as they come in and we'll email you if you've been selected for a short teaching interview. If you have any questions about the hiring process or the position, please email us at cs61a+su20@berkeley.edu
history.subject: Apply as a summer TA for CS61A!
